Files.Description: Power Suite for Windows Embedded Compact Platforms (x86) - (English)
Files.Notes:
Tools included in Power Suite for Windows Embedded Compact Platforms are:
  • Application Verifier for Windows Embedded Compact 7 and Windows Embedded Compact 2013
The Application Verifier tool assesses the stability of an application and detects common programming mistakes. The tool can detect and pinpoint memory leaks, handle leaks (such as critical sections and DLLs), and leaks in graphics device interface (GDI) objects. The tool can also detect some forms of heap corruption.
  • DiskPrep
DiskPrep is a Windows desktop tool that allows developers to make USB, SD/MMC, and Hard Disk media bootable with Windows Embedded Compact. The tool partitions, formats, and installs a BIOS Bootloader to the media, as well as optionally allowing you to install an OS image, splash screen, and boot configuration file. The tool was previously provided as a download from the MSDN Code Gallery, and now is released as part of the Power Suite for Windows Embedded Compact Platforms.
  • .NET CF Debugging Extension
A debugging dll that can help a developer see more debugging output from their applications
  • Silverlight UI Test Framework
A dll that can help a developer build UI automation test code for Silverlight applications.

Files.Description: Multibyte MFC Library for Visual Studio 2015 RC (x86) - (Multiple Languages)
Files.Notes:
This add-on for Visual Studio 2015 RC contains the multibyte character set (MBCS) version of the Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC) Library. You can use this version of MFC to build applications for markets that require MBCS support.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015 RC, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC Release Notes. For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC KB Article.

Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 with Update 5 (x86) - DVD (French)
Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements.

If you already have Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 and just want Update 5, you can download it here.

Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 is the state-of-the-art development solution that empowers teams of all sizes to design, create, and modernize scalable applications that span devices and services. A simplified development solution helps all roles involved in a software project create the high-quality, mission-critical software your company depends on. Empower the team—including operations and trusted stakeholders—to continuously adapt to changes in shorter development cycles so that you can deliver consumer and business applications that exceed customers’ expectations.

Note: If you already have Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 (original release version) and run this download, only Update 5 is installed. If you don't have Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 and run this download, both Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 and Update 5 are installed. In either case, Visual Studio 2013 Language Packs (original release versions) can also be installed.

Support for Visual Studio 2013 is only provided on this current update, which is considered the Visual Studio 2013 Service Pack. The Visual Studio 2013 RTM version, released in November of 2013, will only be supported for one year after the release of this current update. For more information see the Microsoft Support Lifecycle Policy.

VS Release Notes

Files.Description: Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows with Update 5 (x86) - Web Installer (Japanese)
Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements, including tools for Windows Phone 8.1 and 8.0 development.

If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows installed and just want Update 5, you can download it here.

You can use the tools in Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows to create innovative and compelling Windows Phone and Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1. The tools include a full-featured code editor, a powerful debugger, a focused profiler, and rich language support that you can use to build apps that you write in HTML5/JavaScript, C++, C#, or Visual Basic. Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows also includes tools for Windows Phone 8.0 development, a device simulator that you can use to test Windows Store apps on multiple kinds of devices, and Windows Phone emulators that you can use to test how your Windows Phone apps will run on different devices.

Note: If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows (original release version) and run this download, only Update 5 is installed. If you don't have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and run this download, both Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and Update 5 are installed. In either case, Visual Studio 2013 Language Packs (original release versions) can also be installed.

Support for Visual Studio 2013 is only provided on this current update, which is considered the Visual Studio 2013 Service Pack. The Visual Studio 2013 RTM version, released in November of 2013, will only be supported for one year after the release of this current update. For more information see the Microsoft Support Lifecycle Policy.

Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5 (x86) - (Chinese-Simplified)
Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements.

The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger included in the Remote Tools is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2013, Visual Studio Premium 2013, Visual Studio Professional 2013, Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows, and Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop.

Connection to the test features in the Remote Tools requires Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 or Visual Studio Test Professional 2013.

The Remote Tools also enable the installation of a developer license, deployment, debugging, and profiling of Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1 and Windows 8.

Support for Visual Studio 2013 is only provided on this current update, which is considered the Visual Studio 2013 Service Pack. The Visual Studio 2013 RTM version, released in November of 2013, will only be supported for one year after the release of this current update. For more information see the Microsoft Support Lifecycle Policy.

Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements.

Visual Studio Team Foundation Server Express 2013 provides the collaboration hub at the center of the Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) solution. By automating the software delivery process, entire teams can track team actions, transactions, and project artifacts such as requirements, tasks, bugs, source code, build results, and test results. Team Foundation Server Express 2013 enables comprehensive reporting and dashboards that provide historical trending, full traceability, and real-time visibility into software quality.
Note: TFS Express is limited to five (5) users. Larger teams can use Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2013.

These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements, including tools for Windows Phone 8.1 and 8.0 development.

If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows installed and just want Update 5, you can download it here.

You can use the tools in Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows to create innovative and compelling Windows Phone and Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1. The tools include a full-featured code editor, a powerful debugger, a focused profiler, and rich language support that you can use to build apps that you write in HTML5/JavaScript, C++, C#, or Visual Basic. Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows also includes tools for Windows Phone 8.0 development, a device simulator that you can use to test Windows Store apps on multiple kinds of devices, and Windows Phone emulators that you can use to test how your Windows Phone apps will run on different devices.

Note: If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows (original release version) and run this download, only Update 5 is installed. If you don't have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and run this download, both Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and Update 5 are installed. Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5 (x86) - (Italian)
Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements.

The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger included in the Remote Tools is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2013, Visual Studio Premium 2013, Visual Studio Professional 2013, Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows, and Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop.

Connection to the test features in the Remote Tools requires Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 or Visual Studio Test Professional 2013.

The Remote Tools also enable the installation of a developer license, deployment, debugging, and profiling of Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1 and Windows 8.

Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5 (ARM) - (Japanese)
Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements.

The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger included in the Remote Tools is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2013, Visual Studio Premium 2013, Visual Studio Professional 2013, Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows, and Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop.

Connection to the test features in the Remote Tools requires Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 or Visual Studio Test Professional 2013.

The Remote Tools also enable the installation of a developer license, deployment, debugging, and profiling of Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1 and Windows 8.

Support for Visual Studio 2013 is only provided on this current update, which is considered the Visual Studio 2013 Service Pack. The Visual Studio 2013 RTM version, released in November of 2013, will only be supported for one year after the release of this current update. Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements, including tools for Windows Phone 8.1 and 8.0 development.

If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows installed and just want Update 5, you can download it here.

You can use the tools in Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows to create innovative and compelling Windows Phone and Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1. The tools include a full-featured code editor, a powerful debugger, a focused profiler, and rich language support that you can use to build apps that you write in HTML5/JavaScript, C++, C#, or Visual Basic. Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows also includes tools for Windows Phone 8.0 development, a device simulator that you can use to test Windows Store apps on multiple kinds of devices, and Windows Phone emulators that you can use to test how your Windows Phone apps will run on different devices.

Note: If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows (original release version) and run this download, only Update 5 is installed. If you don't have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and run this download, both Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and Update 5 are installed. Team Foundation Server Express 2013 enables comprehensive reporting and dashboards that provide historical trending, full traceability, and real-time visibility into software quality.
Note: TFS Express is limited to five (5) users. Larger teams can use Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2013.

Support for Visual Studio 2013 is only provided on this current update, which is considered the Visual Studio 2013 Service Pack. The Visual Studio 2013 RTM version, released in November of 2013, will only be supported for one year after the release of this current update. For more information see the Microsoft Support Lifecycle Policy.

Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5 (x86) - (English)
Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements.

The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger included in the Remote Tools is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2013, Visual Studio Premium 2013, Visual Studio Professional 2013, Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows, and Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop.

Connection to the test features in the Remote Tools requires Visual Studio Ultimate 2013 or Visual Studio Test Professional 2013.

The Remote Tools also enable the installation of a developer license, deployment, debugging, and profiling of Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1 and Windows 8.

By using Visual Studio Professional 2013, you can deliver quality applications on Windows, Windows Phone, Office, the web, or the cloud.

Files.Description: Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows with Update 5 (x86) - DVD (Korean)
Files.Notes:
These cumulative updates to Visual Studio 2013 include a variety of bug fixes and capability improvements, including tools for Windows Phone 8.1 and 8.0 development.

If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows installed and just want Update 5, you can download it here.

You can use the tools in Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows to create innovative and compelling Windows Phone and Windows Store apps on Windows 8.1. The tools include a full-featured code editor, a powerful debugger, a focused profiler, and rich language support that you can use to build apps that you write in HTML5/JavaScript, C++, C#, or Visual Basic. Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows also includes tools for Windows Phone 8.0 development, a device simulator that you can use to test Windows Store apps on multiple kinds of devices, and Windows Phone emulators that you can use to test how your Windows Phone apps will run on different devices.

Note: If you already have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows (original release version) and run this download, only Update 5 is installed. If you don't have Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and run this download, both Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows and Update 5 are installed. In either case, Visual Studio 2013 Language Packs (original release versions) can also be installed.

Support for Visual Studio 2013 is only provided on this current update, which is considered the Visual Studio 2013 Service Pack. The Visual Studio 2013 RTM version, released in November of 2013, will only be supported for one year after the release of this current update. For more information see the Microsoft Support Lifecycle Policy.

Files.Description: Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 (x86 and x64) - DVD (Spanish)
Files.Notes:
NOTE: A new version of Release Management is available

Starting with TFS 2015 Update 2, Release Management features are integrated into Team Foundation Server (TFS) and into the RELEASE hub in TFS web access. For more information, see Release Management for TFS 2015 and VS Team Services (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/vs/alm/Release/overview).

If you are considering starting with Release Management, you should use the new web-based version. If you are already using the server and client version described in this topic, you should be aware that no new features will be added to this version. We encourage you to move to new web-based version as soon as possible.
----------------------------------------------------------
Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 supports you to configure, approve and deploy your applications for any environment. Create automated deployment orchestrations for each environment no matter how complex the configuration. Delivering your software more frequently and easily to an environment allows your testers to get to work validating your system and keeps your stakeholders involved in giving feedback.

Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 requires Visual Studio Enterprise 2015 or Test Professional 2015. For licensing requirements refer to Visual Studio and MSDN Licensing White Paper.

Note: To enable the release management capabilities, you must also install the Release Management Server for Team Foundation Server 2015. To model release processes and enable graphical views of release status, you must have the Release Management Client for Visual Studio 2015. For agent-based releases, on every target machine to which you want to publish deployments, you must install Microsoft Deployment Agent 2015. For vNext Releases, you don’t need to install Microsoft Deployment Agent on the target machine.

VS Release Notes
TFS Release Notes
TFS Known Issues
System Requirements
Compatibility

Files.Description: Agents for Visual Studio 2015 (x86 and x64) - (English)
Files.Notes:
Use Agents for Visual Studio 2015 for distributing automated tests across multiple remote machines for continuous testing in Team Build or Release Management pipelines. The agent package can be downloaded, installed, and configured using the ‘Visual Studio Test Agent Deployment’ task from the task catalog. Couple this with the ‘Run Functional Tests’ task for running tests and collecting diagnostic data such as code coverage.

Agents for Visual Studio 2015 cannot be used for load testing, running functional tests in the XAML build workflows, running automated tests using Microsoft Test Manager (MTM) or for managing lab environments using Visual Studio Lab Management.

For these scenarios, please use Agents for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5.

For more details, please refer this page.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015, see the Visual Studio 2015 Release Notes.

For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 KB Article

VS Release Notes

Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 (x86) - (Japanese)
Files.Notes:
The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from, the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger and profiler that are included in the Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 RC is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2015 RC.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015 RC, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC Release Notes. For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC KB Article.

Visual Studio Enterprise 2015 is an integrated, end-to-end solution for teams of any size with demanding quality and scale needs that require comprehensive tools and services for defining, building and managing complex enterprise applications and solutions targeting Microsoft’s full Enterprise platform as well as cross-platform technologies.

It is recommended that you sign in using the Microsoft account associated with your active MSDN subscription in order to unlock Visual Studio. By signing in, your IDE settings will sync across devices, and you can connect to online developer services. Some customers may also have access to product keys which can be used to unlock Visual Studio.

VS Release Notes
TFS Release Notes
VS Known Issues
System Requirements
Compatibility

Files.Description: Release Management Client for Visual Studio 2015 (x86 and x64) - Web Installer (French)
Files.Notes:
NOTE: A new version of Release Management is available

Starting with TFS 2015 Update 2, Release Management features are integrated into Team Foundation Server (TFS) and into the RELEASE hub in TFS web access. For more information, see Release Management for TFS 2015 and VS Team Services (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/vs/alm/Release/overview).

If you are considering starting with Release Management, you should use the new web-based version. If you are already using the server and client version described in this topic, you should be aware that no new features will be added to this version. We encourage you to move to new web-based version as soon as possible.
----------------------------------------------------------
Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 supports you to configure, approve and deploy your applications for any environment. Create automated deployment orchestrations for each environment no matter how complex the configuration. Delivering your software more frequently and easily to an environment allows your testers to get to work validating your system and keeps your stakeholders involved in giving feedback.

Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 requires Visual Studio Enterprise 2015 or Test Professional 2015. For licensing requirements refer to Visual Studio and MSDN Licensing White Paper.

Note: To enable the release management capabilities, you must also install the Release Management Server for Team Foundation Server 2015. To model release processes and enable graphical views of release status, you must have the Release Management Client for Visual Studio 2015. For agent-based releases, on every target machine to which you want to publish deployments, you must install Microsoft Deployment Agent 2015. For vNext Releases, you don’t need to install Microsoft Deployment Agent on the target machine.

VS Release Notes
TFS Release Notes
TFS Known Issues
System Requirements
Compatibility

Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 (x86) - (Chinese-Traditional)
Files.Notes:
The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from, the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger and profiler that are included in the Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 RC is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2015 RC.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015 RC, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC Release Notes. For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC KB Article.

Files.Description: Visual Studio 2015 SDK (x86 and x64) - (English)
Files.Notes:
By using the Visual Studio 2015 SDK, you can create tool windows, menu commands, editor extensions, isolated shell projects, and other extensions for Visual Studio. The Visual Studio 2015 SDK includes project templates that help you package Visual Studio extensions in a VSIX for redistribution. The SDK also helps you test and debug your extensions in an experimental instance of Visual Studio so that your primary development environment is not changed unexpectedly.

Files.Description: Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2015 (x86) - (Multiple Languages)
Files.Notes:
The Visual C++ Redistributable Packages install run-time components of Visual C++ libraries. These components are required to run C++ applications that are developed using Visual Studio 2015 and link dynamically to Visual C++ libraries. These package can be used to run such applications on a computer even if it does not have Visual Studio 2015 installed. These packages install run-time components of these libraries: C Runtime (CRT), Standard C++, MFC, C++ AMP, and OpenMP.

Files.Notes:
NOTE: A new version of Release Management is available

Starting with TFS 2015 Update 2, Release Management features are integrated into Team Foundation Server (TFS) and into the RELEASE hub in TFS web access. For more information, see Release Management for TFS 2015 and VS Team Services (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/vs/alm/Release/overview).

If you are considering starting with Release Management, you should use the new web-based version. If you are already using the server and client version described in this topic, you should be aware that no new features will be added to this version. We encourage you to move to new web-based version as soon as possible.
----------------------------------------------------------
Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 supports you to configure, approve and deploy your applications for any environment. Create automated deployment orchestrations for each environment no matter how complex the configuration. Delivering your software more frequently and easily to an environment allows your testers to get to work validating your system and keeps your stakeholders involved in giving feedback.

Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 requires Visual Studio Enterprise 2015 or Test Professional 2015. For licensing requirements refer to Visual Studio and MSDN Licensing White Paper.

Note: To enable the release management capabilities, you must also install the Release Management Server for Team Foundation Server 2015. To model release processes and enable graphical views of release status, you must have the Release Management Client for Visual Studio 2015. For agent-based releases, on every target machine to which you want to publish deployments, you must install Microsoft Deployment Agent 2015. For vNext Releases, you don’t need to install Microsoft Deployment Agent on the target machine.

Files.Description: Modeling SDK for Visual Studio 2015 (x86 and x64) - (English)
Files.Notes:
The Modeling SDK for Visual Studio 2015 provides:
  • MSBuild tasks that enable the indexing of assemblies and PDB files as part of a build or on the command line. The code index is used by Code Map, but it can be used on its own as well.
  • Project templates that help developers create graphical or form-based (Windows Forms and WPF) designers for use in Visual Studio to view and modify models for a custom domain-specific language.
  • Project templates that help developers create extensions for the Architecture Tools in Visual Studio Ultimate 2015.
  • MSBuild tasks that enable the generation of textual artifacts at build time for any use of T4.
  • Reference assemblies and IntelliSense documentation for the DSL Tools runtime, which is included in Visual Studio 2015.
  • A migration tool that helps DSL authors migrate designers from Visual Studio 2013 VsVmSdk SDK to work with Visual Studio 2015.
  • Header files that contain Command IDs for the graphical designers and the architecture tools (UML designers, Layer designer).
Before this SDK can be installed, the Visual Studio 2015 SDK (VSSDK) must be installed first.

VS Release Notes
TFS Release Notes
VS Known Issues
System Requirements
Compatibility

Files.Description: Agents for Visual Studio 2015 (x86 and x64) - (Chinese-Simplified)
Files.Notes:
Use Agents for Visual Studio 2015 for distributing automated tests across multiple remote machines for continuous testing in Team Build or Release Management pipelines. The agent package can be downloaded, installed, and configured using the ‘Visual Studio Test Agent Deployment’ task from the task catalog. Couple this with the ‘Run Functional Tests’ task for running tests and collecting diagnostic data such as code coverage.

Agents for Visual Studio 2015 cannot be used for load testing, running functional tests in the XAML build workflows, running automated tests using Microsoft Test Manager (MTM) or for managing lab environments using Visual Studio Lab Management.

For these scenarios, please use Agents for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5.

For more details, please refer this page.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015, see the Visual Studio 2015 Release Notes.

For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 KB Article

You can request feedback from stakeholders, or they can provide rich feedback—for example, screenshots, audio, video, and attachments—that's tightly integrated into Visual Studio Team Foundation Server and Visual Studio Online.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015, see the Visual Studio 2015 Release Notes. For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 KB Article.

Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 (x86) - (Korean)
Files.Notes:
The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from, the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger and profiler that are included in the Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 RC is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2015 RC.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015 RC, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC Release Notes. For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 RC KB Article.

Files.Description: Visual Studio Test Professional 2015 (x86 and x64) - Web Installer (Italian)
Files.Notes:
Visual Studio Test Professional 2015 is ideal for testers, business analysts, product managers, and other stakeholders who need team collaboration tools but not a full development IDE. These team members can use integrated testing and product management tools that keep stakeholders involved resulting in higher quality across the development process. Visual Studio Test Professional 2015 supports lightweight requirements definition and continuous customer feedback, and also provides traceability across these processes.

Visual Studio Express for Windows Desktop lets you take full advantage of Windows with XAML designers, a productive IDE, and a variety of programming languages including C#, Visual Basic, and C++. Choose between Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF), Windows Forms, and Win32, to target the Windows desktop with the right technology for your application and your skills.

Files.Notes:
Visual Studio Enterprise 2015 is an integrated, end-to-end solution for teams of any size with demanding quality and scale needs that require comprehensive tools and services for defining, building and managing complex enterprise applications and solutions targeting Microsoft’s full Enterprise platform as well as cross-platform technologies.

It is recommended that you sign in using the Microsoft account associated with your active MSDN subscription in order to unlock Visual Studio. Files.Description: Visual Studio Test Professional 2015 Language Pack (x86 and x64) - (Korean)
Files.Notes:
Visual Studio Test Professional 2015 Language Pack enables the display of some of the UI in different languages. After you install the Language Pack, you can switch among the languages. Visual Studio Test Professional 2015 must be installed before you can install the Language Pack.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015, see the Visual Studio 2015 Release Notes. For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 KB Article.

Files.Description: Agents for Visual Studio 2015 (x86 and x64) - (Chinese-Traditional)
Files.Notes:
Use Agents for Visual Studio 2015 for distributing automated tests across multiple remote machines for continuous testing in Team Build or Release Management pipelines. The agent package can be downloaded, installed, and configured using the ‘Visual Studio Test Agent Deployment’ task from the task catalog. Couple this with the ‘Run Functional Tests’ task for running tests and collecting diagnostic data such as code coverage.

Agents for Visual Studio 2015 cannot be used for load testing, running functional tests in the XAML build workflows, running automated tests using Microsoft Test Manager (MTM) or for managing lab environments using Visual Studio Lab Management.

For these scenarios, please use Agents for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5.

For more details, please refer this page.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015, see the Visual Studio 2015 Release Notes.

For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 KB Article

VS Release Notes
TFS Release Notes
VS Known Issues
System Requirements
Compatibility

Files.Description: Release Management Server for Team Foundation Server 2015 (x86 and x64) - Web Installer (Chinese-Simplified)
Files.Notes:
NOTE: A new version of Release Management is available

Starting with TFS 2015 Update 2, Release Management features are integrated into Team Foundation Server (TFS) and into the RELEASE hub in TFS web access. For more information, see Release Management for TFS 2015 and VS Team Services (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/vs/alm/Release/overview).

If you are considering starting with Release Management, you should use the new web-based version. If you are already using the server and client version described in this topic, you should be aware that no new features will be added to this version. We encourage you to move to new web-based version as soon as possible.
----------------------------------------------------------
Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 supports you to configure, approve and deploy your applications for any environment. Create automated deployment orchestrations for each environment no matter how complex the configuration. Delivering your software more frequently and easily to an environment allows your testers to get to work validating your system and keeps your stakeholders involved in giving feedback.

Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 requires Visual Studio Enterprise 2015 or Test Professional 2015. For licensing requirements refer to Visual Studio and MSDN Licensing White Paper.

Note: To enable the release management capabilities, you must also install the Release Management Server for Team Foundation Server 2015. To model release processes and enable graphical views of release status, you must have the Release Management Client for Visual Studio 2015. For agent-based releases, on every target machine to which you want to publish deployments, you must install Microsoft Deployment Agent 2015. For vNext Releases, you don’t need to install Microsoft Deployment Agent on the target machine.

VS Release Notes
TFS Release Notes
TFS Known Issues
System Requirements
Compatibility

Files.Description: Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 (ARM) - (English)
Files.Notes:
The Remote Tools are intended for computers that don't have Visual Studio so that you can debug, test, and profile apps that are executing on them. Visual Studio must be installed on the development computer that's connected to, or uses the data collected from, the remote computer. Connecting to the remote debugger and profiler that are included in the Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 RC is supported in Visual Studio Ultimate 2015 RC.

Files.Description: Agents for Visual Studio 2015 (x86 and x64) - (Russian)
Files.Notes:
Use Agents for Visual Studio 2015 for distributing automated tests across multiple remote machines for continuous testing in Team Build or Release Management pipelines. The agent package can be downloaded, installed, and configured using the ‘Visual Studio Test Agent Deployment’ task from the task catalog. Couple this with the ‘Run Functional Tests’ task for running tests and collecting diagnostic data such as code coverage.

Agents for Visual Studio 2015 cannot be used for load testing, running functional tests in the XAML build workflows, running automated tests using Microsoft Test Manager (MTM) or for managing lab environments using Visual Studio Lab Management.

For these scenarios, please use Agents for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5.

For more details, please refer this page.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015, see the Visual Studio 2015 Release Notes.

Files.Description: Feedback Client for Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2015 (x86 and x64) - Web Installer (Spanish)
Files.Notes:
By working with your stakeholders to install the Feedback Client for TFS on their computers, you can collect feedback about your software projects. You can request feedback from stakeholders, or they can provide rich feedback—for example, screenshots, audio, video, and attachments—that's tightly integrated into Visual Studio Team Foundation Server and Visual Studio Online.

To find out what's new in Visual Studio 2015, see the Visual Studio 2015 Release Notes. For a list of fixed bugs and known issues, see the Visual Studio 2015 KB Article.

Files.Description: Release Management Server for Team Foundation Server 2015 (x86 and x64) - Web Installer (Chinese-Traditional)
Files.Notes:
NOTE: A new version of Release Management is available

Starting with TFS 2015 Update 2, Release Management features are integrated into Team Foundation Server (TFS) and into the RELEASE hub in TFS web access. For more information, see Release Management for TFS 2015 and VS Team Services (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/vs/alm/Release/overview).

If you are considering starting with Release Management, you should use the new web-based version. If you are already using the server and client version described in this topic, you should be aware that no new features will be added to this version. We encourage you to move to new web-based version as soon as possible.
----------------------------------------------------------
Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 supports you to configure, approve and deploy your applications for any environment. Create automated deployment orchestrations for each environment no matter how complex the configuration. Delivering your software more frequently and easily to an environment allows your testers to get to work validating your system and keeps your stakeholders involved in giving feedback.

Release Management for Visual Studio 2015 requires Visual Studio Enterprise 2015 or Test Professional 2015. For licensing requirements refer to Visual Studio and MSDN Licensing White Paper.

Note: To enable the release management capabilities, you must also install the Release Management Server for Team Foundation Server 2015. To model release processes and enable graphical views of release status, you must have the Release Management Client for Visual Studio 2015. For agent-based releases, on every target machine to which you want to publish deployments, you must install Microsoft Deployment Agent 2015. For vNext Releases, you don’t need to install Microsoft Deployment Agent on the target machine.

VS Release Notes
TFS Release Notes
